Please... stop this madness. I just found you yesterday and am in the middle of watching and comprehending your series about neural networks, and now you bombard me with a bunch of other content creators who love what they do and create awesome content? I can't take it anymore.
There's like infinity+1 things I want to do and learn about and just as many smart and passionate people coming up with new stuff to wrap my mind around. The fact I could never even scratch the surface of knowing and doing everything drives me insane.
I don't want to stick to one thing. I don't want to stick to only a couple of things. Too much beautiful stuff worth doing to limit myself. PERIOD.
The worst thing about that is my inability to mute this nagging voice. This annoying little part of my brain that lets me know about the Infinity+1 things I'm currently not doing instead of letting me appreciate the fact I can choose to pursue anything I desire.
I'm paralyzed by too many choices.
I don't know how to deal with this.
Please send help.

I was wondering if you could do a piece on the Golden Ratio. Specifically, I would like to hear your take on the meaning behind its prevalence in Nature. I am a research scientist in social and cognitive sciences. I have noted the ratio of positions of axons of neurons in the human brain (the spacing between axons as they relate to the cell body) often equate quite closely to the Golden Angle. I have also seen this phenomenon with ganglia, or groups of neurons, and neighborhoods of ganglia. This is obviously difficult to confirm in living humans; nevertheless, the Golden Ratio is there, I am quite sure. Do you have any thoughts on this? Thank you.

Subbed to them all, been looking for some good channels like these, thanks! Also, thought you might like to know, I've always struggled when thinking of what to name myself, especially in videos games. Recently, however, as a result of my recent fascination with mathematics my go to names have been Mandelbrot and as many digits of phi as the character name allows (1.61803398874989).  Never ever got a comment on any name I had in video games until I did this, but now I'm literally always getting people who want to establish themselves as math fans, who openly compliment the name because it has appeal, like an numerical aesthetic it at least represents. I just find that fascinating, cause before that I'd really begun to think the prevalance of these types of thought patterns had been starting to die out.
About that sharing, that's just cause you do one of the best math explanations that are both entertaining and educational

Thank you Grant. You certainly are a gift to us all. Thank you and congratulations on a well deserved 1 Million sub's. :-)

I am beginning studying for my start to Calc 2 in the fall. I had such a struggle for 3 semesters in Calc 1 that I am trying to spend a good amount of time during the summer just studying on my own to try and give myself a leg up.

The beginning of Calc 2 introduces the idea of an infinite number of slices where the slice is some surface area A(x). The integral on a range of that A(x) is the volume of the resultant solid. Doing this for a sphere and proving the sphere volume formula was an awakening moment for me. I mean, it was visceral and deeply intuitive once seen. One of those things that cements what I have learned until now and ties it to something I have always known, like an anchor. So I began to look deeper into the volume of a sphere.....where did it originally come from?! Surely it wasn't from integral calculus!!!

Would you consider doing a video example of Archimedes "On the sphere and cylinder" proof of the volume of a sphere? I think it would be an amazing video on a very very rarely talked about topic. Honestly, its something I find a bit difficult to wrap my head around as well......
